greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiply n by its largest prime factor: a(n) = A006530(n) * n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: A052126(a(n)) = n. [A052126 works as an inverse function for this injection.]
xref: Essentially the same as A129598, except that here we have a(1) = 1.
Cf. A070003 (same sequence without 1, sorted into ascending order).
Differs from A072995 for the first time at n=15, where a(15) = 75, while A072995(15) = 225.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 03 2015
